Detailed Description

Compiler defines which are internally enabled via APOXI makefiles. The feature defines comprise all the defines, which are set via an APOXI feature.

These types of defines are only activated via APOXI features. They must not be declared explicitly, because they are enabled simply by adding the Corresponding features to the project configuration. Internally these features must be linked to the according feature. The feature developer is in charge of preparing this link.

In the common build environment (CBE) this link is enabled in the file cbe_apoxi_makeoptions.mk, located in the directory ${GLOBALPATH}/lnz_apoxi/Apoxi.


Naming convention for new created feature defines:

APOXI_<feature>[_<functionality>], where

  • <feature> is the name of the Corresponding features.
  • <functionality> is any description of a detailed feature functionality (e.g. if the whole feature is covered by one define, then the keyword SUPPORT must be used).

Define Documentation

#define APOXI_3D_AMPLIFIER_SUPPORT
 

Adds the themes 'Foggy Theme' and 'Customizable Theme'.

This feature enables the 3D enhanced stereo support.


Corresponding features:

  • FEAT_3D_AMPLIFIER

#define APOXI_ADDITIONAL_THEMES_SUPPORT
 

Adds the themes 'Foggy Theme' and 'Customizable Theme'.

Adds the themes 'Foggy Theme' and 'Customizable Theme' to the already available 'Default Theme'.


Corresponding features:

  • ADDITIONAL_THEMES

#define APOXI_ARAGON_SUPPORT
 

Enables support for ARAGON.

When user interface design by the host system is desired, this feature must be enabled, otherwise GUI component properties can not be read out of the FFS.


Corresponding features:

  • ARAGON

#define APOXI_AT_MMI_INTERWORKING_CALL
 

Call interworking with other clients.

If APOXI is not the only client for the stack it is necessary to have some interworking with other clients. Normally ATC is the second client which is the case if bluetooth is activated. In this case this define activates the interworking for call handling and call related supplementary services.


Corresponding features:

  • AT_MMI_INTERWORKING

#define APOXI_AT_MMI_INTERWORKING_SIMTK
 

SIMTK interworking with other clients.

If APOXI is not the only client for the stack it is necessary to have some interworking with other clients. Normally ATC is the second client which is the case if bluetooth is activated. In this case this define activates the interworking for SIMTK(Sim Toolkit).


Corresponding features:

  • AT_MMI_INTERWORKING

#define APOXI_AT_MMI_INTERWORKING_SS
 

SS interworking with other clients.

If APOXI is not the only client for the stack it is necessary to have some interworking with other clients. Normally ATC is the second client which is the case if bluetooth is activated. In this case this define activates the interworking for SS(Supplementary Service).


Corresponding features:

  • AT_MMI_INTERWORKING

#define APOXI_AT_MMI_INTERWORKING_USSD
 

USSD interworking with other clients.

If APOXI is not the only client for the stack it is necessary to have some interworking with other clients. Normally ATC is the second client which is the case if bluetooth is activated. In this case this define activates the interworking for USSD(Unstructured Supplementary Service Structure).


Corresponding features:

  • AT_MMI_INTERWORKING

#define APOXI_ATL_SUPPORT
 

Enables support for ATL.

This feature must be enabled if ATL classes are used. ATL support is required by ARAGON.
Corresponding features:

  • ATL

#define APOXI_BT_A2DP_SUPPORT
 

Bluetooth Advanced Audio Distribution Profile

A2DP is a Bluetooth profile that allows the sending of high quality audio data to a remote device (Sink). This feature enables functionality in APOXI Bluetooth, APOXI Audio and the BTAPI stack.


Corresponding features::

  • FEAT_BT_A2DP


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_BLUETOOTH_A2DP_SUPPORT

#define APOXI_CAMERA_MPE_COMPAT
 

Backwards compat define for MPE camera features

Enable this define, if there are problems with MPE camera functionality. E.g. WhiteBalance, Metering and Exposure may not be available in the MPE driver.


Corresponding features:

  • CAMERA

#define APOXI_CAMERA_SUPPORT
 

Enables the support for the still camera and video camera device.

Enables the support for the still camera and video camera device. If the support is enabled, the CameraConfig must be available, which also instantiates the devices for camera and video.


Corresponding features:

  • CAMERA

#define APOXI_CAMERA_TWINVIEWFINDER_SUPPORT
 

TwinViewfinder

This defines enables Twinviewfinder support for Camera. This may be only supported on special customer projects and is NOT available on the MPE platform itself. By defaul, this define is NOT enabled.


Corresponding features:

  • CAMERA

#define APOXI_CTM
 

Activate TTY.

For dumb and deaf people it is not possible to use common phones. With a additional device to the phone it is possible to visualize speech on a screen and typed text is translated to speech. This must be supported by the provider because the translation from speech to text and vice versa must be done there. With this feature the support for TTY is activated in APOXI. CTM ... Cordless Telephone/Terminal Mobility


Corresponding features:

  • TTY

#define APOXI_DUAL_DISPLAY_SUPPORT
 

Enables dual display support for the default DisplayConfig class.

Enables dual display support for the default DisplayConfig class, so that the customization for dual display support is more easy. The define itself is not used by APOXI itself and only meant for allow to turn on the feature DUAL_DISPLAY without touching the class DisplayConfig.


Corresponding features:

  • DUAL_DISPLAY

#define APOXI_EXTERNAL_PCH_CONTROL_SUPPORT
 

Enables external PCH control support.

Enables support to monitor and control external GPRS data connections (used via AT terminals). The MMI can listen to the ExternalPdpContextInfoMsg message to be informed when the user sets up or terminates a GPRS data connection via AT. Furthermore it is also possible to force the termination of an external GPRS data connection via MMI.


Corresponding features:

  • FEAT_EXTERNAL_PCH_CONTROL

#define APOXI_FACTORY_CUSTOMIZATION_SUPPORT
 

Allows to use factory customized packs for languages and T9 dictionaries.

Allows to use factory customized packs for languages and T9 dictionaries.


Corresponding features:

  • INTERNATIONALIZATION


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_INTERNATIONALIZATION
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_FM_RADIO_SUPPORT
 

FM radio support

Support of the FM Radio device including capabilities such as station search or RDS


Corresponding features:

  • FMRADIO


Define dependencies:

  • N/A


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_FM_RADIO_NOT_SUPPORTED
  • obsoleted define cleared out: N/A

#define APOXI_FOTA_SUPPORT
 

Firmware update Over The Air

This feature enables Firmware update over the air in APOXI. For detailed description see class Fota.


Corresponding features:

  • FEAT_FOTA

#define APOXI_LIB_ADDON_MMCALL
 

Multimedia Call Handling API

This feature enables APOXI Multimedia Call Hanlding. It provides an interface equivalent to the Voice Call Handling for setting up a MM MOC, accepting or rejecting a MM MTC, for releasing a MM call and provides access to the data stored in the CallHandlingData object of MainHandler.


Corresponding features:

  • FEAT_MMCALL

#define APOXI_MP3_SUPPORT
 

MP3 support having codec available in the firmware

This feature should be enabled whenever the FW provides MP3 codec. This feature should not be defined when the decoding is done in MMFr (ex. MPE)


Corresponding features:

  • MP3


Define dependencies:

  • N/A


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: N/A
  • obsoleted define cleared out: N/A

#define APOXI_MULTIMEDIA_SUPPORT
 

Enables the addon multimedia, which contains image decoders and a multimedia editor.

Enables the addon multimedia. The addon contains image decoders for PNG, JPEG, PNG, WBMP, BMP and a multimedia editor.


Corresponding features:

  • MULTIMEDIA

#define APOXI_PNG_ENCODER_SUPPORT
 

Enables the PNG encoder.

Enables the APOXI support for PNG encoding.


Corresponding features:

  • PNG_ENCODER

#define APOXI_SECURECLOCK_SUPPORT
 

Secure Clock

Enables additional interfaces in class RealTimeClock to access secure clock information. See RealTimeClock::GetSecureDateTime and RealTimeClock::IsSecureClockValid.


Corresponding features:

  • FEAT_SECURECLOCK

#define APOXI_SVG_SUPPORT
 

Enables support for scalable vector graphics.

Enables support for scalable vector graphics.


Corresponding features:

  • SVG

#define APOXI_T9_SUPPORT
 

Enables the predictive text engine T9.

Enables the predictive text engine T9.


Corresponding features:

  • T9


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_INCLUDE_T9
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_UNITTEST
 

Enables APOXI Unittest framework

Enables the APOXI Unittest framework.


Corresponding features:

  • UNITTEST


Define dependencies:

  • APOXI_UNITTEST_TCPIP is automatically set if feature SOCKET is enabled.
  • APOXI_UNITTEST_NO_MESSAGE is automatically set if feature DEBUG_INFO is not enabled.
  • APOXI_UNITTEST_NO_FILENAMES is automatically set if feature DEBUG_INFO is not enabled.

#define APOXI_UNITTEST_NO_FILENAMES
 

Disables output of filenames, where a unittest failed.

This define deactivates the output of filenames for failed unit tests. It is automatically set, when the feature DEBUG_INFO is not enabled.


Corresponding features:

  • UNITTEST
  • DEBUG_INFO


Define dependencies:

  • APOXI_UNITTEST mandatory

#define APOXI_UNITTEST_NO_MESSAGE
 

Disables extensive console output while unittest run.

This define deactivates the output of information about the unittest runs on the console. It is automatically set, when the feature DEBUG_INFO is not enabled.


Corresponding features:

  • UNITTEST
  • DEBUG_INFO


Define dependencies:

  • APOXI_UNITTEST mandatory

#define APOXI_UNITTEST_TCPIP
 

Enable TCP/IP connections for controlling unit tests.

This define activates the possibility to run unit tests from an host application on the phone over a socket connection. It is automatically set, when the feature SOCKET is enabled.


Corresponding features:

  • UNITTEST
  • SOCKET


Define dependencies:

  • APOXI_UNITTEST mandatory

#define APOXI_UUS_SUPPORT
 

Enables UUS support

Enables APOXI UUS support. Currently only UUS1 implicit is supported.


Corresponding features:

  • UUS

#define APOXI_VIDEO_SUPPORT
 

Enables video support for the display device.

Enables video support for the display device. Usually the class VideoChannel from Devices must be adapted to the hardware configuration.


Corresponding features:

  • MULTIMEDIA

#define APOXI_YAMAHA_MAPI_SUPPORT
 

Yamaha Mapi

The Yamaha MA3 and MA5 chips can be controlled directly through the Yamaha Music API (a set of C-functions wrapping the lower-level Yamaha sound middleware).


Corresponding feature:

  • YAMAHA_MAPI

#define APOXI_YAMAHA_RINGER_SUPPORT
 

Enables the YAMAHA audio player.

Enables the playback of MIDI, SMAF audio formats on MAx YAMAHA IC


Corresponding features:

  • EXTERNAL_RINGER

#define APOXI_ZI8_SUPPORT
 

Enables the predictive text engine eZi text.

Enables the predictive text engine eZi text.


Corresponding features:

  • ZI8


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_INCLUDE_ZI8
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0
